title: Union Learning Representative Capacity Building: Organizational Learning Facilitation Strategies

context.prior_knowledge: Expert-level knowledge and experience in solving complex problems
context.additional_context: Learners are in-service labor union practitioners who can flexibly engage with digital devices; project-based assessments verify on-site application capabilities

learning_goals: Learners can design three practical strategies to improve learning accessibility for marginalized groups within labor unions.
Learners complete microlearning modules with an 80% or higher completion rate in mobile environments and apply learning facilitation techniques.

Learners can develop an action plan (including goals, strategies, budget, evaluation methods) to spread organizational learning culture in public/nonprofit institutions through project-based assessment (team assignment), create a 10-minute presentation, and achieve an 'Excellent' grade in ≥2 of the 3 peer evaluation rubric items (clarity, feasibility, innovation).
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
